emailColumn.title: 24ttl

authorInfo.title: From the Author
authorInfo.description:
24TTL is a company that specializes in providing innovative solutions for e-commerce, focusing on enhancing the online shopping experience for both retailers and brands. The company is headquartered in Dubai, United Arab Emirates, but operates internationally, including recently expanding to Seoul, South Korea, to tap into the innovative e-commerce market there.

 24TTL is recognized for changing the customer experience in e-commerce and is trusted by Fortune Global 500 companies. They have partnerships with over 400 retailers and marketplaces, focusing on delivering a seamless and omnichannel buying process for online shoppers.

materialsUsed: UAE Ministry of Economy. (2025). Business Expansion in UAE: Opportunities & Growth Strategies.
Netherlands Trade & Investment Office. (2024). Market Entry Strategy Guide for the Netherlands.
Indonesia Investment Coordinating Board (BKPM). (2025). Business Expansion to Indonesia: Complete Strategy Guide.
Mexico Trade & Investment Promotion. (2024). Benefits and Challenges of Expanding to Mexico.
Harvard Business Review. (2023). Cultural Understanding Impact on Global Expansion Strategies.
McKinsey & Company. (2024). International Business Expansion: Cultural Adaptation Framework.
World Bank. (2025). Doing Business Report - Cross-Country Analysis.
Baker Institute. (2024). Nearshoring in Mexico: Opportunities and Challenges.

keyTakeaways.title: Key Takeaways
keyTakeaways.description: Successful international expansion requires local entity establishment, deep cultural understanding, systematic business development approach, and long-term commitment. Quick spray-and-pray strategies often fail - sustainable growth comes from building reputation, trust, and genuine local partnerships over time.

emails.subject: The Genesis: From Russia to Dubai - Our First International Leap
emails.body:
FROM 🇷🇺 TO 🇦🇪: Our Global Journey Begins! ✈️

Started as a Russian agency in 2016 📅 Working with big brands like LG 💼

Then magic happened... 🪄
Our LG client moved to Dubai and said: "Your work is WAY better than what's here locally. Come with us!" 🔥

Suddenly we're flying ✈️ back and forth:
• Meet clients 🤝
• Get briefs 📋
• Deliver results ✅

Reality check: UAE market was YEARS behind Russia in e-commerce 🛒

BUT here's the game-changer 💡
👉 You NEED local presence to really grow internationally
👉 Remote work only gets you so far
👉 Real growth = local teams + local ops

#InternationalBusiness #StartupLife #GlobalExpansion #Entrepreneurship #BusinessLessons #Dubai #Russia #Ecommerce #24TTL

highlight.title: Client-Driven Market Entry
highlight.description: Sometimes the best market opportunities come through existing client relationships rather than theoretical market analysis - but success requires eventual local establishment

emails.subject: Why Local Entities Matter: From Services to SaaS Across Markets
emails.body:
GAME CHANGER: From Agency to SaaS 🚀

2019 = PIVOT YEAR 🔄
Switched from services to IT/SaaS business

Why this matters 👇
✅ Sell same product multiple times
✅ Scale across markets
✅ Work remotely

BUT plot twist... 😱
Big enterprise clients ONLY want local partners!

Reasons:
• Tax stuff 💸
• VAT reclaim 🧾
• Compliance headaches 😵

So we opened entities:
🇳🇱 Netherlands (2020)
🇦🇪 Dubai (2022)

Launched 10 products → Only 4 survived 📊
But those 4? PURE GOLD 🏆

Europe gave us:
💰 Higher purchasing power
💰 Better order values
💰 More GMV

Then 2022 happened... 💥
Americans: "We don't work with Russians" 🚫
Contract canceled overnight 😤

Dubai became our lifeline:
• Only 1hr time difference from Russia 🕐
• Neutral territory 🤝
• Banking infrastructure ✅

Sometimes forced moves = best opportunities! 🎯

#SaaS #TechStartup #GlobalBusiness #PivotStory #Entrepreneurship #Dubai #Netherlands #Resilience #24TTL

highlight.title: Local Entity Imperative
highlight.description: Enterprise clients require local legal entities for tax efficiency and regulatory compliance - remote operations have fundamental limitations for B2B growth

emails.subject: Market Selection: Why UAE, Mexico, and Indonesia Made Sense
emails.body:
MARKET SELECTION 101: Where to Expand? 🌍

Post-crisis, we had OPTIONS:
🇺🇸 U.S. | Portugal | Asia | LatAm

Our strategy? Test 3 markets simultaneously 🎯

🇲🇽 MEXICO
Why: Sister Anna ran accelerator there
Thought: Easy gateway to U.S. market
REALITY: Cultural clash with "mañana" attitude 😅
COST: $130K for ONE client 💸

🇮🇩 INDONESIA
Why: Dubai client moved there
POTENTIAL: 270M people + growing e-commerce 📈
RESULT: 6 clients (Samsung, Panasonic) ✅
BONUS: Expanding to Singapore/Malaysia 🚀

🇦🇪 UAE
Why: Our steady base since 2016
ADVANTAGE: Almost zero competition vs Europe
STATUS: Rock solid foundation 💪

Each market = different lessons:
• Competition levels ⚔️
• Cultural nuances 🎭
• Customer behavior patterns 📊

Key takeaway 👇
Don't put all eggs in one basket!
Test multiple markets, see where magic happens ✨

#MarketExpansion #GlobalStrategy #Entrepreneurship #BusinessLessons #Mexico #Indonesia #UAE #StartupLife #24TTL

highlight.title: Portfolio Approach to Markets
highlight.description: Testing multiple markets simultaneously helps identify where natural traction occurs - but requires significant resources and cultural adaptation for each region

emails.subject: Expensive Lessons: What We Got Wrong in the U.S. Market
emails.body:
💸 $100K MISTAKE: What NOT to Do in America 🇺🇸

Here's how we FAILED in the world's biggest market 👇

MISTAKE #1: No clear budget or timeline 🤦‍♂️
We just "figured it out as we go"
Result: Endless money drain 💸

MISTAKE #2: Tiny team for HUGE market 😅
1-2 people trying to crack Samsung/LG?
In the most competitive market on Earth? ⚔️
Yeah... that didn't work 🤡

REALITY CHECK:
• U.S. = Salesforce, SAP territory
• Big brands need EXTRAORDINARY value
• Small teams = instant failure

Our solution only works for BIG brands 🏢
SMBs just hire 2 people instead
So we're stuck in enterprise hell 😵

THE DAMAGE:
💰 $50K-$100K spent
✈️ Roadshows, NRF Chicago
👥 Hired biz-dev team
📅 1 full year invested

Result: ZERO 🥜

LESSON LEARNED:
Don't casually enter hyper-competitive markets
You need:
✅ Extraordinary product
✅ Systematic approach
✅ Serious funding
✅ Local expertise

Sometimes the biggest markets aren't the best markets 🎯

#StartupFail #BusinessLessons #USA #MarketEntry #Entrepreneurship #Mistakes #LessonsLearned #24TTL

highlight.title: Enterprise Sales Reality Check
highlight.description: Hyper-competitive markets like the U.S. require extraordinary value propositions and systematic approaches - small teams cannot penetrate established enterprise markets

emails.subject: Cultural Nuances: The Hidden Business Killers We Discovered
emails.body:
CULTURE SHOCK: When Politeness = Business Killer 😵

Going global? Prepare for MIND-BENDING cultural differences 🌍

THE TRAP WE FELL INTO 👇

🇲🇽 MEXICO:
"You're great guys!" = Means NOTHING
Mexicans literally CAN'T say "no" directly 🚫
There are YouTube videos on how to say "yes" properly!
Say "sim" instead of "sí"? You're instantly BUSTED as foreign 🤦‍♂️

🇮🇩 INDONESIA:
Same politeness trap 🪤
We mistook nice words for validation
HUGE mistake!

OUR MATH WAS WRONG:
💰 300k MRR × 20 markets = Unicorn! 🦄
BUT reality check:
No deep integration = No real success

You need to:
👀 Be seen 20+ times at events
🤝 Know everyone personally
🏠 Actually LIVE there

HIRING REALITY:
🇲🇽 Mexico: $4k/month (English speakers)
🇮🇩 Indonesia: $1k/month
🇦🇪 Dubai: $2.5k-3k/month

Mexican team = BRUTAL 😤
No feedback tolerance
Russian bluntness = DISASTER
People playing phone games in Zoom! 📱

Indonesian team = Chill vibes 😌
Responsible but relaxed
Cultural fit = EVERYTHING

#CulturalDifferences #GlobalBusiness #Mexico #Indonesia #StartupLife #BusinessLessons #Hiring #TeamBuilding #24TTL

highlight.title: Cultural Misreading Trap
highlight.description: Politeness is often mistaken for business validation - understanding indirect communication styles and cultural feedback patterns is crucial for accurate market assessment

emails.subject: Fracturing Success: How We Split Teams Across Four Markets
emails.body:
TEAM SPLIT: How We Divided & Conquered 4 Markets 🌍

FROM 1 BUSINESS TO 4 CHAOS 🤯
Mature Russia + 3 startup experiments
Now: Russia + Global startup ✅

BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT = 3 ROLES:
1️⃣ Contact miners (LinkedIn scraping) 💼
2️⃣ SDRs (emails + WhatsApp) 📧💬
3️⃣ Account executives (closing deals) 🤝

We tried doing it ourselves...
Broken English + Zero local trust = FAIL 😅

THE MAGIC: Cultural matching 🎯

👨‍💼 Gen → Mexico 🇲🇽
Why? Loves football ⚽ + culture fit
PERFECT match!

👨‍💼 Tyoma → Indonesia 🇮🇩
Why? Bali lifestyle called to him 🏝️
Vibes aligned!

Dubai team = United Nations 🌍
🇸🇾 Syrians
🇮🇷 Iranians
🇮🇳 Indians
Multicultural magic with regional expertise!

LANGUAGE = EVERYTHING 🗣️
Hired locals through agencies
Authentic market penetration finally!

LEAD GEN EXPERIMENT:
💰 $5k/month for meetings
Month 1: AMAZING results ✅
Month 2: Ghosted everywhere 👻

So we STOLE their playbooks 😈
200 leads → SDR → calls → LinkedIn automation

Cultural fit > Everything else 💡

#TeamBuilding #GlobalTeams #CulturalFit #Leadership #Mexico #Indonesia #Dubai #StartupLife #24TTL

highlight.title: Cultural Leadership Matching
highlight.description: Matching leadership personalities with market cultures significantly improves team performance and market penetration - cultural fit affects operational success

emails.subject: Managing Chaos: Lessons from Running Four Markets Simultaneously
emails.body:
CHAOS MODE: Managing 4 Markets Simultaneously 🤯

Here's what nearly broke us 👇

TIMEZONE HELL 🕐
Gen: "You're ignoring Mexico!" 🇲🇽
Me: Trying to sync at 3am 😵
Indonesia: Only +4h (manageable) 🇮🇩

BIG MISTAKE #1: "Growth Director" 🤦‍♂️
Too early to delegate!
Year 1: I barely touched biz-dev
Reports: "Great meetings! Amazing connections!" ✨
Revenue: ZERO 💀

After 1.5 years: PIVOT TIME ⚡
❌ Slashed teams
🎯 Hyper-focused on deals

OUR $2M EDUCATION:
1️⃣ Spray-and-pray = Expensive lesson 💸
2️⃣ Validate first, scale later 💡
3️⃣ Timezone sprawl kills coordination 🕐

Now testing Korea 🇰🇷:
1 full-time + 2 interns 👨‍🎓👩‍🎓
Smart approach finally!

SURPRISE WIN: Community Building 🏘️
Only Tyoma & I believed in it
Russia: FLOP 🇷🇺
Indonesia: EXPLOSION 💥🇮🇩

Now it's our #1 B2B weapon! 🚀
Meta-events (IDRF forum) = Pure gold
We totally underestimated this power ⚡

CURRENT FOCUS:
🥇 Dubai (daily presence)
🥈 Indonesia (timezone advantage)
🥉 Russia (steady operations)
🤷‍♂️ Mexico (neglected child)

Lesson: Build community BEFORE selling! 🏘️→💰

#StartupChaos #GlobalExpansion #CommunityBuilding #BusinessLessons #Dubai #Indonesia #Entrepreneurship #24TTL

highlight.title: Reputation Before Revenue
highlight.description: Community-building and reputation development often matter more than direct sales efforts - B2B markets require trust and relationship-building over time
